intro: Crepidorhopalon hepperi, commonly known as the Hepper's rock daisy, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its compact, shrub-like growth habit. The plant produces small, daisy-like flowers with yellow centers and white petals, typically blooming in spring. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
